{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3322715,"name":"Baran Marap","username":"b_marap","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/7ea924/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T20:26:04.404Z","cooked":"

We are running our SDS MK4 L2’s with neos connected to spark maxes, cancoders and a Pigeon 2. We followed the wiki and other issues on Github to get it mostly up and running properly.

However the odometry readings show up as the robot is rotating the exact opposite way, therefore causing our field oriented drive to not work properly unless we are 0 or 180 degrees from start.

We’ve tried inverting the pigeon in the json but it has seemingly no effect to either raw values or the gyro widget in the shuffleboard. We’ve set up the FRC-Web-Components to see if the swerve was trying to do the stuff we want and it seems to have no issues. When we try to rotate clockwise, the swerve modules have vectors corresponding to a cw rotation, the robot rotates clockwise, but the chassis object on the dashboard and field widget turn the other way.

I’ll leave our test code git link below. Thanks in advance!

9020-Test Code Git

The widget’s don’t always reflect the inversion state, however the raw gyro should reflect it always. You’re wording of “the exact opposite” is vague and nondescriptive. Make sure you’re using the most up to date code too.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T21:02:32.308Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":33.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":457074,"topic_slug":"yagsl-swerve-odometry-issue","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL & YASS Creator "},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-swerve-odometry-issue/457074/2","custom_user_title":"YAGSL & YASS Creator ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3322771,"name":"Baran Marap","username":"b_marap","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/7ea924/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T21:34:26.085Z","cooked":"

Thanks for the reply,

The raw gyro data seems to always decrease ccw no matter what the inversion value is set to.

To explain the exact opposite issue:
1 - We give a positive input from our controller’s rotation axis (Moving the right stick to the left gives a negative input so we multiply it by -1)
2 - The robot rotates counter clockwise as expected. Let’s say 90 degrees.
3 - The vectors displayed on the swerve drive object in web components seem to display correct values. (Tangential vectors pointing to the expected rotation direction)
4 - Swerve widget and robot on the field widget turns 90 degrees cw instead of ccw.
5 - Since the rotation direction is wrong, when we try to go forwards while using field oriented drive, the robot drives backwards.

I’ve also tried setting the gyro to inverted after initialising the swerve drive object using swerveDrive.swerveDriveConfiguration.imu.setInverted(true); in the subystem’s constructor but raw gyro values still didn’t invert.

I’d sent a video showing both the robot and the dashboard screen at the same time but it’s midnight here and the students are already out of the workshop so we’d have to wait till tomorrow for that.

This seems like something that can be solved with the 8 steps.

yagsl.gitbook.io

The eight steps

We’ve tried these and it didn’t solve our issue. I am guessing we only need to invert the gyro to get it working. However, the invertion doesn’t seem to affect anything. Here are two videos of our dashboard with robot in the background:

1 - IMU inversion set to false

drive.google.com

inverted=false

Google Drive file.

2 - IMU inversion set to true

drive.google.com

inverted=true

Google Drive file.

Any ideas what might be causing this issue or any data/logs we can share to give you more of an idea?

b_marap:

I am guessing we only need to invert the gyro to get it working.

No, it isnt, as i said earlier, follow the 8 steps in the documentation which involve more than just inverting the IMU…

yagsl.gitbook.io

The eight steps

We’ve tried all 8 steps before but we made some changes to our inputs later. It might worth trying it again, I’ll get back to you once we do. Thanks!

For those who are having similar issues with pigeon2, our problem was gyro not being set to inverted. We fixed it by physically turning the gyro 180 degrees.

@nstrike we are observing the same behavior that was reported here. setting the gyro inverted flag to true does not appear to change the gyro values. we would strongly prefer not to rotate our gyro 180 degrees based on the design of the rest of our robot. do you have any advice? We have followed the 8 steps and are on the latest version of the code.

We have the code working again. Our roborio was upside down below our robot, when we tested in rightside up again everything behaved as expected (the flag seems to be changing behavior as expected again). So my best guess right now is that the NavX doesn’t perform well upside down? Which doesn’t make much sense to me.
